meanings.definition: To reverse the process of making something.
meanings.sent1: She was unmaking the bed to wash the sheets.
meanings.sent2: He regretted unmaking the decision to go on the trip.
meanings.sent3: The magician was unmaking the rabbit disappear and reappear.
meanings.sent4: The artist was unmaking the painting, layer by layer.
meanings.sent5: The chef was unmaking the cake to fix a mistake.

meanings.sent1: The storm was unmaking the sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent2: The villain's plan was unmaking the peace in the kingdom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy was unmaking the neatly stacked books.
meanings.sent4: The fire was unmaking the carefully built house.
meanings.sent5: The careless mistake was unmaking all her hard work.

meanings.definition: The act of causing something to cease to exist.
meanings.sent1: The unmaking of the treaty led to conflict between the nations.
meanings.sent2: The unmaking of the company was a result of poor management.
meanings.sent3: The unmaking of the sandcastle by the waves was inevitable.
meanings.sent4: The unmaking of the painting was a deliberate artistic choice.
meanings.sent5: The unmaking of the cake was due to a baking mishap.
